13968188.projn:
BJ-Benin:  Emergency Food Security Support
            Project -- P113374
13968188.trustfund:
TF093250-BENIN: EMERGENCY FOOD SECURITY
            SUPPORT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Benin - Emergency Food Security Support
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The project objective of the Emergency
            Food Security Support Project for Benin is to increase
            domestic production of cereals, particularly maize and rice
            to mitigate the short-term impact of increasing prices on
            households, while strengthening the capacity of the country
            to cope in the medium and long-term. The changes include:
            the extension of closing date is required to allow the
            country to complete all project activities. This will in
            particular provide additional time and resources to: (i)
            carry out a detailed survey that will be used to monitor
            progress towards the achievement of project development
            objective (PDO) as well to establish baseline indicators for
            the Emergency Support to Enhance Food Security Project
            currently under implementation by the same project team;
            (ii) carry out a technical audit to assess the effectiveness
            of the activities planned and carried out under the project
            in response to food crisis. The results of the audit will
            assess the overall effectiveness of project implementation
            and will provide evidence for improved and best practices;
            (iii) undertake the audit of distribution of agricultural
            inputs whose objective is to produce a report in which an
            opinion shall be issued on the mechanisms put in place to
            manage fertilizers and pesticides during the past two years.
            The audit report also identifies the strengths and
            weaknesses identified in the operative management of
            pesticides and fertilizers, and will propose measures to
            make it truly operational and efficient; (iv) improve the
            inputs storage conditions to ease up the process of
            management and provision of fertilizer; (v) provide small
            equipment (GPS) to field agents in order to improve the
            reliability of the estimation of agricultural acreages and
            yields; and (vi) ensure trough training the understanding by
            the implementing entities and various stakeholders of the
            project Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF).

13235299.trustfund:
TF093250-BENIN: EMERGENCY FOOD SECURITY
            SUPPORT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Benin - Emergency Support to Enhance Food
            Security (ESEFS) Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Emergency
            Support to Enhance Food Security (ESEFS) Project of Benin is
            to assist producers to increase domestic food production in
            the short term. Specifically, these include: 1) stockpile
            family, community and buffer consumer food products to put
            on the market during the lean season to alleviate the
            pressure on prices; 2) produce in the short-term adequate
            amounts of food in order to stifle or at least mitigate the
            perverse impact of this crisis on the quality of life of
            both urban and rural populations; 3) develop more in the
            long term by having a strategic reserve of food security in
            particular with respect to rice and corn. Negative
            biophysical impacts include: Loss of aquatic habitats; Loss
            of area of terrestrial vegetation and wildlife habitat;
            Deteriorating quality of water resources (surface and
            groundwater) due to residue of pesticides and other
            synthetic chemical pollutants; Decimation of non-target
            organisms (auxiliary) by pesticides and other harmful
            explosion of cultures; Degrading of land through
            salinization, alkalinization and acidification; Poisoning of
            the food chain through bioaccumulation in particular in
            areas where irrigation and pesticide use have been combined;
            Exhaustion of potential groundwater resources by excessive
            pumping for agriculture; Contamination of crops by
            agricultural mismanagement of input storage in stores;
            Pollution of soil and waters by oil spills and chemical
            inputs to synthesis. Negative health impacts include:
            Mortality due to acute food poisoning linked to the
            mismanagement of pesticides packaging or processing of grain
            by pesticides; Increased prevalence of food-borne diseases
            related to water ; Contamination of livestock due to
            degradation of water quality of reservoirs; Increased cases
            of conflicts between herders and farmers with the
            development of agricultural areas; Land insecurity.

repnme.cdata!:
Benin - Emergency Food Security Support
            Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Emergency
            Program for Support of Food Security is to assist producers
            to increase domestic food production in the short term.
            Specifically, these include: a) stockpiling consumer food
            products to put on the market during the lean season to
            reduce pressure on prices; b) producing short-term adequate
            supply of food in order to stifle or at least mitigate the
            adverse impact of the crisis on the quality of life of both
            urban and rural populations; 3) developing a strategic
            reserve of food security, especially with regard to rice and
            corn. Inappropriate farming practices contribute to the
            degradation of environment, particularly in soils by the
            accentuation of the phenomena of erosion, loss of fertility,
            and drainage areas. Potential negative impacts of pesticide
            use include: Declining fertility, acidification and
            pollution of the soil; pollution (nitrates, ammonium NH4);
            changing pH and deforestation; making pests resistant to
            chemical control; poisoning of humans and even death. In
            addition, there may be conflicts between herders and farmers
            with the development of agricultural areas and an increase
            in waterborne diseases.

repnme.cdata!: Benin - Emergency Food Security Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Food Security Support
            Project  for Benin's development objective is to
            increase domestic production of cereal crops (maize and
            rice), in order to mitigate the short-term impact of
            increasing prices on households and to expand food crop
            farmers' access to agricultural inputs in the medium
            and long term. The grant will help finance the costs
            associated with enhancing the production of rice and maize,
            cereals for which the national food balance is negative. The
            project will subsidize emergency operations for the
            provision of fertilizer to 50,000 producers' of rice
            and maize in 2009. This should result in additional domestic
            production of about 60,000 tons of cereal (6,000 tons of
            rice and 54,000 tons of maize) in 2009 (8 percent of the
            total production in 2007). Moreover, the project will
            support the design of the innovative market based mechanisms
            required for the delivery of inputs to food crops producers
            in the medium and long terms.
